sentences.en: " When you call me'senior ', I feel like a prehistoric relic.
sentences.cn: 你叫我‘前辈 ’, 我已经觉得像史前原人的遗骸了.

sentences.en: It falls entirely within prehistoric times.
sentences.cn: 它是完全属于史前时代的事.

sentences.en: It was rather like an exhibition of prehistoric electronic equipment.
sentences.cn: 这儿倒像是在展览古老的电子设备.

sentences.en: Local folklore has it that prehistoric men drove cattle over these cliffs.
sentences.cn: 当地民间传说中称,史前人类把野牛从这些悬崖上驱赶下去.

sentences.en: New Grange is one of the most extravagantly decorated prehistoric tombs.
sentences.cn: 新格兰奇是装饰最豪华的史前陵墓之一.
史前的狩猎者和采集者

sentences.en: Some prehistoric people lived in caves.
sentences.cn: 有些史前时期的人住在洞穴里.

sentences.en: The Ainu settlers in Hokkaido are the last remnant of a prehistoric race.
sentences.cn: 北海道的阿伊努人是史前某个种族的最后残存者.

sentences.en: The beginning of libraries came after the end of the prehistoric era.
sentences.cn: 图书馆起源于史前时代结束之后.

sentences.en: The display of prehistoric monsters is comically naive.
sentences.cn: 史前怪物的展览幼稚可笑。

sentences.en: The'seed " itself might be the tooth of a prehistoric shark.
sentences.cn: 这颗 “ 种子 ” 本身也许是一颗史前鲨鱼的牙齿.

sentences.en: We know a great deal about those fascinating prehistoric animals, the dinosaurs.
sentences.cn: 关于那些十分引人注意的史前动物――恐龙――的情况,我们知道得不算少.

sentences.en: We visited the prehistoric burial grounds discovered last year.
sentences.cn: 我们参观了去年发现的史前墓葬地.

words.tran_cn: 史前；史前史；（导致事件、危机等的）背景

trans.tran_en: relating to the time in history before anything was written down
